Text: CGAS Hawaii Sec TrustLooks like we have exposure on the sale of CGAS despite the MM being off balance sheet I feel strongly we will beat the MM carry value of any excess will accrue to ENA See my note at the bottom on CGAS sale expectations Original Message From Delacey Charles Sent Wednesday May PM To Pruett Steve Subject RE Hawaii Sec Trust You are right Enron has a obligation to the banks under the total return swap confirm for the MM plus accrued interest the only dif is that it does not show up on the balance sheet CIBC is at risk for K plus yeild if the sale of the asset is less than and the origional owner of the asset ENA could take a hit if the proceeds of the asset sale does not equal the amount monitized ie the full Original Message From Delacey Charles Sent Wednesday May PM To Pruett Steve Subject RE Hawaii Sec Trust Steve Joe was down here when i got your message He said he had spoken to John about this and would give you a call If you still need a memo let me know The answer is that there is a obligation of ENE on the swap for MM but it is not on the balance sheet The total return swaps are buried in the footnotes under price risk management activities securitizations paragraph on page of this years annual report Original Message From Pruett Steve Sent Wednesday May PM To Delacey Charles Subject RE Hawaii Sec Trust I understand the split Is there any balance sheet exposure credit support for the MM in the total return swap Original Message From Delacey Charles Sent Wednesday May PM To Pruett Steve Subject RE Hawaii Sec Trust steve of the MM CGAS that was monetized in Hawaii is covered by an ENE total return swap and the remaining is equity risk held by CIBC with no credit support from ENE Original Message From Pruett Steve Sent Wednesday May AM To Deffner Joseph Proffitt Tim Delacey Charles Subject Hawaii Sec Trust Gentlemen John Lavorato has asked me relative to CGAS which is in the Hawaii vehicle whether Enron has any implicit guarantees behind Hawaii Could one of you confirm with John via email that there is no implicit or explicit guarantee to CIBC from Enron on the performance of the investments sold to CIBC Am I correct in thinking that CIBC invested MM of equity in the deal On a related matter I informed the CGAS executive team that Enron will initiate a sales process within the next two weeks and will return to Columbus in midMay with our divestment advisor Books would go out in late June dataroom in July offers in August and in Q possibly late Q Drilling results are strong as is cash flow E EBITDA of MM vs MM in MM in Appalachian gas reserves are of interest to a broader set of participants today than last year we have a better track record and EP companies access to capital is much better now than it was when we pulled the failed offering this time last year indicated equity value of MM Therefore I am confident Enron will net MM more than the sale price to CIBC of MM Steven H Pruett Vice President Energy Capital Resources Enron North America Phone Fax
